Class UpdateManagementDBController

java.lang.Object
dbLogic.managmentDB.UpdateManagementDBController
public class UpdateManagementDBController extends Object
Controller for managing database updates for the restaurant management system. This class handles regular and special operating hours updates using SQL transactions.

  • Method Details

    • updateRegularHours

      public static boolean updateRegularHours(int restaurantId, Map<String, TimeRange> newHours)
      Updates the regular operating hours for a specific restaurant across multiple days.

      This method performs a transactional update to ensure data integrity. For each day provided in the map, it:

      1. Ensures the specific time range exists in the time_range table.
      2. Retrieves the unique ID for that time range.
      3. Performs an "Upsert" (Insert or Update) into the restaurant_regular_hours table.
      If any part of the process fails, the entire transaction is rolled back to maintain database consistency.

      Parameters:
      restaurantId - The unique identifier of the restaurant to update.
      newHours - A Map where keys are days of the week (e.g., "Monday") and values are TimeRange objects containing start and end times.
      Returns:
      true if the operation was successful and committed; false if a database error occurred and changes were rolled back.

    • updateSpecialHours

      public static boolean updateSpecialHours(int restaurantId, LocalDate date, String open, String close)
      Updates or inserts special operating hours for a restaurant on a specific date.

      This method ensures that special hours (e.g., for holidays or one-time events) are recorded in the database. It uses a transactional approach to:

      1. Retrieve or create a unique ID for the given time range using a helper method.
      2. Perform an "Upsert" operation on the restaurant_special_hours table.
      If any database error occurs during the process, all changes are rolled back to maintain data consistency.

      Parameters:
      restaurantId - The unique identifier of the restaurant.
      date - The specific LocalDate for which the special hours apply.
      open - The opening time as a string (e.g., "08:00").
      close - The closing time as a string (e.g., "22:00").
      Returns:
      true if the update was successfully committed; false if a database error occurred or the transaction was rolled back.

    • deleteAllSpecialHours

      public static boolean deleteAllSpecialHours(int restaurantId)
      Deletes all special operating hours associated with a specific restaurant.

      This method removes every record in the restaurant_special_hours table that matches the given restaurant ID. The operation is wrapped in a transaction to ensure that the deletion is atomic; if a database error occurs, the transaction is rolled back.

      Parameters:
      restaurantId - The unique identifier of the restaurant whose special hours should be removed.
      Returns:
      true if the records were successfully deleted and the transaction committed; false if a database error occurred.

    • checkStayDurationAlerts

      public static void checkStayDurationAlerts()
      Monitors and manages visits that have exceeded the maximum allowed stay duration.

      This method queries the database for all 'ACTIVE' visits that started more than 120 minutes ago. For each overdue visit, it attempts to transition the status to 'BILL_PENDING' using updateVisitStatus(long, String). If the update is successful, an alert is logged to the server console.

      *

      Threshold: 120 minutes (2 hours).

    • checkReservationReminders

      public static void checkReservationReminders()
      Checks for upcoming reservations and logs reminders for those scheduled within the next two hours.

      This method queries the reservation table for records with an 'ACTIVE' status where the time difference between the current time and the reservation datetime is between 0 and 120 minutes. For each eligible reservation, it:

      1. Logs a reminder message to the ServerController.
      2. Updates the reservation status to 'NOTIFIED' via updateReservationStatus(String, String) to ensure reminders are not sent multiple times.

    • cancelLateReservations

      public static void cancelLateReservations()
      Automatically cancels active reservations where the customer failed to arrive within the permitted grace period.

      This method identifies reservations that are still marked as 'ACTIVE' but have exceeded their scheduled time by more than 15 minutes without a corresponding entry in the visit table (meaning the customer never checked in). Such reservations are updated to a 'NOSHOW' status.

      Grace Period: 15 minutes.

    • createNewSubscriber

      public static Object createNewSubscriber(String phone, String email)
      Registers a new subscriber in the system by creating records in both 'user' and 'subscriber' tables.

      This method follows an atomic transactional process:

      1. Checks if the provided phone number already exists in the system to prevent duplicates.
      2. Inserts basic contact information into the user table and retrieves the generated user ID.
      3. Generates a unique 6-digit subscriber ID and creates a corresponding entry in the subscriber table.
      If any step fails, the transaction is rolled back to maintain database integrity.

      Parameters:
      phone - The phone number of the new subscriber (used as a unique identifier check).
      email - The email address of the new subscriber.
      Returns:
      An Object which is either:
      • A Long representing the newly generated subscriber ID upon success.
      • A String containing an error message if the phone exists or a database error occurs.

    • getWaitingListEntries

      public static ArrayList<WaitingListEntry> getWaitingListEntries()
      Retrieves all active waiting list entries from the database.

      This method queries the waiting_list_entry table to fetch records with a status of either 'WAITING' or 'NOTIFIED'. Each row in the result set is mapped to a WaitingListEntry object and added to the returned list.

      Returns:
      An ArrayList<common.WaitingListEntry> containing the retrieved waiting list entries. Returns an empty list if no matching records are found or if a database error occurs.
